title: Ticket #1652: Schedd controls who sends alives
description: STARTD_SENDS_ALIVES is an error-prone knob, especially when flocking. If the submit and execute machines don't have it set the same, then you can end up in a situation where neither daemon is sending keep-alives, and all jobs die an early death. There should be one place where the decision of who sends the keep-alives for a given claim is made. The schedd makes the most sense. At the start of the claim, the schedd should inform the startd who is responsible for sending keep-alives. The default should be for the startd to send them. And both daemons should be backwards-compatible with older versions.
